title: Drawing, "Mountain Peak, Possibly Chimborazo, Rising over Three Successive Mountain Ranges, Ecuador", 1857
markings: Verso:  Stamped in ink, at center:  Lugt 457 c
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite with numbers throughout and across center at various locations:  grey / Dark / Dusky purple brown / green; again, at upper left:  2 Dazzling blue yellowish / 3 over [....?] / 4-  Grows less lunimous (very obvious) 6 clouds smoky shadows and lights orange / 7- Dazzling white / 8 Luminous edge; and again at lower left:  Mountain looks pure / white [A word has been struck out in graphite in left bottom corner.]
description: Horizontal view of a mountain peak rising in the background over three successive ranges with a house and trees indicated in the left foreground.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Mountain Peak, Possibly Chimborazo, Rising over Three Successive Mountain Ranges, Ecuador", 1857. Graphite on cream-colored paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-827.
